Description:
Take advantage of the $25k Building Scheme and $20k FHB - TITLED LAND
The new federal government $25,000 building scheme that has been announced, has seen many buyers enquiring for titled land. Well look no further than this 554m2 TITLED land ready to go and be built on, with great frontage to Prouses Road and depth into the allotment.
No restrictions on covenants here, put a building permit in place and start the process straight away once approved. Minutes to Lake Weeroona and Bendigo Central.
Situated amongst established reputable homes, with mature trees and paved area. Don't miss the opportunity here.

Description:
Regent Park - Strathfieldsaye
Here's your chance to secure a block in an already booming established estate with its own children's playground, Jenny's Early Learning Centre and easy access to public transport!
Perfect for families and only a quick drive to Bendigo CBD.
The beautiful open entrance gives way to plenty of space, with approximately 3 acres of park filled with native and exotic trees and bushland, 800m of walking paths as well as benches and shelter making the perfect spot to get together. All allotments are titled and are waiting to be built on.
Located on Strathmore Court is Lot 2 situated on 338m2 with a frontage of 12.5m2 being a more affordable and smaller allotment offering up the opportunity for a smaller and easily maintainable home.

Description:
Family Home Of Luxurious Proportions
Sitting on approximately 800 square metres, this 3 bedroom family home offers space for the whole family. With a large open plan living, dining and kitchen area as well as second formal living space, a three grand bedrooms.
Master bedroom offers, walk in robe and generous ensuite, bedroom two and three both with built in robes.
The kitchen itself has stone bench tops, walk in pantry, and large 900mm wide gas cooktop, oven and range hood.
The home also offers, double lock up garage, huge secure back yard with alfresco deck, and central heating and cooling throughout.
Situated only 400m from Epsom Primary School, 700m from Aldi & Woolworths supermarkets and 10 minutes in to the Bendigo CBD.
Contact Matt Ingram today.

Description:
A BEAUTIFUL BLEND OF LIGHT AND LOCATION
Like a breath of fresh air, this light and airy home will calm and revitalise your senses with its soft décor and beachy vibe.
The one-owner, six-year-old home presented in as-new condition consists of four bedrooms, two sleek bathrooms, versatile lounge/sitting room and expansive open-plan kitchen, dining and living areas spilling onto a covered rear alfresco.
Northern light fills the galley style kitchen equipped with long island bench for food prepping and casual dining, gas/electric cooking appliances, dishwasher and ample storage including a pantry.
The main bedroom with walk-through robe and ensuite isolated at the front with the remaining bedrooms, bathroom and laundry positioned together beyond the kitchen.
Extra features include lime-washed timber-look flooring, ducted heating and cooling plus a split system a/c, solar hot water service, 1.5m x 3m garden shed, double garage with remote door and internal access, extra off-street parking and side access to the secure backyard.
Set on approx 512m², in a new home area and embraced by low maintenance landscaping, the residence enjoys great neighbours on one side and a treed reserve and walking path on the other. Heading north on the walking path leads to the Viewpoint Playground and recreation area while the southbound path passes another tranquil park for 200 metres before ending at the Waratah Road bus stop.
Internal area
16928m²

Description:
CENTRAL FLORA HILL WINNER
Live the nostalgia of the 70s in this neat light filled Flora Hill winner.
Set on a 650m2 block in central Ellis Street sits this well-kept and neatly presented three bedroom two bathroom home featuring a sunroom, an abundance of natural light and period style details complimenting its original appeal.
Refurbishing and updating would be idyllic with its floor plan and original fittings creating the perfect foundations to bring this abode into the modern era while still highlighting its character.
The kitchen is a standout with its spacious layout, floor to ceiling storage cupboards and modern quality appliances.
The master bedroom is impressive with its size, walk in robe, ensuite with separate toilet and views of the gardens.
All three bedrooms, large laundry with outdoor access and a neat light filled main bathroom makes up the rest of the features in the hallway at the back of the property.
Outside, the beautiful large lemon tree sets the scene of the serene backyard; easy maintenance garden beds, a powered timber lock-up workshop/storage and separate clothes line area.
Located only 2kms to Bendigo CBD and around the corner to La Trobe University, schools, kindergarten, day care, local shops, Kennington and Strath village shopping centres and public transport.
Call Shelby today to inspect

Description:
Attention All Trotting Enthusiasts
As soon as you enter "Rocket Ville" you will notice the attention to detail that has been put into this property from the gateways to the fencing and a 800 meter trotting track that has been engineered and designed to the highest standards. The property consists of 26 acres a 3 bedroom brick veneer home, 6 stables and excellent shedding and fencing.
Within the home you will find timber cathedral ceilings in the living and kitchen /dinning and as you head down the hallway there are 3 good size bedrooms with built in robes a 3 piece bathroom and en suite off the main bedroom. At the end of the hall is a large room suitable for a second living, rumpus / hobby room or very large office.
Outside all the gardens are low maintenance with an area for your vegetable garden and options to extend if you wish.
Down at the stables you will also see that all the hard work has been done with a large shed (24m x 8m), wash pen, sand lunging ring, steel yards, crush loading bay and many more additions.
Options to expand are also available as the stables were designed that the 6 could easily be designed to 12 if needed and their is plenty of room to add or redesign to suit. With 4 large water tanks and a stock and domestic bore the water has been taken care of not to forget the 4 meg dam designed to be used to swim the horses through as it is 80m long x 28m wide and 3m deep.
The property is fenced into 9 paddocks and has the seasonal Sweeney Creek running through it where there is one small paddock over the creek.
Call today for a private inspection

Description:
One Acre on Town Water
This attractive home is perfectly set up for summer enjoyment.
A cool green haven surrounds this fine family home, the established gardens are spectacular.
From the sparkling pool to the huge undercover pergola leading straight out from the kitchen, to the fantastic shedding at the rear of the property. The interior of the home is beautifully presented from front to back. This property has:
Plenty of room to store the boat or caravan, or maybe a mens shed set up
Four bedrooms upstairs with ensuite and family bathroom with ducted cooling for these hot days
Downstairs offers 4 living areas, Formal lounge, Rumpus Games Room, Sitting room, and Family room
An extra powder room off the laundry
Casual dining area and Formal dining area with an updated dream kitchen that has plenty of storage and bench space to satisfy any cook
Fully covered resort style pergola, perfect for family barbeques and next to your very own pool
Yes it has the lot, beautifully built and lovingly maintained by the original owners, especially the garden and manicured paths
Close to the schools and shops this home invites a private inspection to appreciate how lovely it is

Description:
Packed with Potential.
Add to the investment portfolio and bring in additional rental income with this North Bendigo three-bedroom opportunity.
Or invest, refresh and occupy for yourself as a first home buyer, this home has plenty of potential to make it your comfortable retreat.
Set on a generous 758 square metre block and close to North Bendigo Sporting facilities, Prouses Road Recreation Reserves, Bendigo Health and schools or a short drive into the CBD the location is set to delight.
Refurbishing and updating would be idyllic with its floor plan creating the perfect foundation to bring this abode into the modern era while still highlighting its character.
The kitchen offers all the essentials including a stove top, oven, overhead storage and the perfect footprint for a fresh fit out.
Each bedroom offers built-in robes and is serviced by the main bathroom featuring a beautiful leadlight window - and separate toilet.
Ceiling fans, gas heater and electric air conditioner in the lounge adds to this property's comfort and investment potential.
Outside is where the opportunity continues with the space providing an open canvas to create your own style.
Vehicle access to the right of the home, paving, a concreted garden shed, plenty of shady trees creating additional privacy and a back patio adds to home's appeal.
A walk to nearby Prouses Road and North Bendigo Recreation Reserve and close to Bendigo Bendigo Health, schools, daycares and Bendigo CBD the location is a standout.
Contact agent Jesse Forbes to arrange your inspection today.
Internal area
96m²

Description:
Invest, Downsize or First home!
Situated at the rear of an established complex, this brick veneer unit offers a neat and spacious environment in an ideal location.
The property comprises of a spacious open living area with split system and gas heating for all year-round comfort, functional kitchen with gas cooking, two good sized bedrooms each with built-in-robes, a tasteful three-piece bathroom, separate toilet and laundry.
Externally there is a single lock up garage with access to the enclosed courtyard and secure fenced yard. There is an abundance of visitor car parking around the unit and the complex abuts a lovely nature reserve to one side.
This low maintenance, light and bright unit has been recently repainted and refurbished throughout ready for its new owners.
Public transport is out the front, with a convenience store and school very close by. Located close to the Bendigo Hospital and the city, this unit would also make an ideal investment opportunity.

Address: 3/27 Little Breen Street Quarry Hill VIC 3550
Description:
City Central Living.
Sound investments are all about the return and the location - this one ticks both boxes.
This tidy three-bedroom townhouse in a city-edge setting is the ideal live-in or let-out proposition.
The main bedroom enjoys access to the two-way bathroom and separate toilet, while the remaining two bedrooms open off the central hallway.
There's a spacious lounge room at the front and an open-style kitchen/dining/living basking in northern light and winter sunshine at the end of the hallway.
The kitchen boasts gas cooktop, electric under-bench oven, pantry cupboard and plenty of storage.
Sliding doors from the dining area open to a fully-enclosed, secure backyard with a paved area for outdoor dining.
A single lock-up carport and maintenance-free landscaping complete the neat package currently leased at $290 per week to a happy tenant willing to stay on if possible.
The rear townhouse in a complex of four offers extra privacy and security and a top location mere steps from everything you could ever need ditch the car and walk to CBD shops, railway station, cafes, cinema, etc.

Description:
Prestige and Position
Positioned in a lovely private court in popular Strathfieldsaye, this immaculate contemporary family home is just minutes from everything you need. This home presents beautifully, from street appeal through to the open plan living. The impressive open plan kitchen allows free flowing spaces between indoor and outdoor entertaining. The large main bedroom offers built in robes and a large ensuite with double shower plus a rain head shower. The remaining bedrooms have built in robes and are serviced by the large family bathroom.
The home is designed with the creature comforts in mind, offering ducted reverse cycle heating and refrigerated cooling. An oversized garage with direct access to the rear yard plus an additional area for trailer storage to the left of the home. The fully landscaped garden is irrigated and established with mature trees creating a feeling of privacy.
First home buyers should be able to capitalise on the $20,000 First Home Owners Grant plus reduced stamp duty while an astute investor can collect $420 per week as the property is leased until 12 April 2021.
Inside Features:
Large main bedroom with built in robes and ensuite
Ducted reverse cycle heating & refrigerated air conditioning
Caesar-stone benchtops
Open plan living
Outside Features:
Extra Large Double garage with auto door and access to rear yard
Secure fencing
Alfresco area
3.0 kw Solar panels
Watering system and trailer storage
With easy living in mind the open plan design maximizes the size of the allotment, which is located within walking distance to the fantastic local primary school, sports oval, cafes, bakeries, shopping centre and healthcare, just to name just a few.

Address: 200 Sandhurst Town Road Myers Flat VIC 3556
Description:
Idyllic Country Homestead
Breathe in the serenity and soak up the space in this idyllic country family homestead. Nestled among the trees sits this beautifully presented property on 16 acres of land in Myers Flat, boasting the ultimate in family comfort, practicality and privacy and even has its own pool, grand entertaining patio, impressive machinery shed and horse stables, with town water connected and backing onto tranquil Myers Creek.
Step inside the light and bright home and you'll get a feel for how your family will utilise each area with a country style kitchen, two separate living areas - one with a wood burning fireplace - and dining with views of the backyard.
The neat kitchen boasts plenty of storage options with its floor to ceiling cupboards, and features a free-standing oven and plenty of bench space.
Timber flooring throughout, master with walk-in robe and ensuite, large practical laundry, as well as ducted heating and cooling make up the inside features, while a double carport, 5.5m x 6.7m garage and garden shed add to the home's outdoor appeal.
Unique to this property is its abundance of storage and lifestyle opportunities including a massive 25m x 13m machinery shed with a designated workshop, concrete slab and three-phase power.
Another standout is the inground and fenced pool, entertaining deck and veranda, and the generous horse stables - offering 7 stable capacity - on the property.
Reap the added privacy benefits with no direct neighbours and its adjacency to Myers Creek while also being close to Marong and Maiden Gully shops, schools, healthcare, transport and a 15-minute drive to Bendigo CBD.

Description:
HARMONIOUS FAMILY DOMAIN IN EXCLUSIVE ILLOURA PLACE
A quality home built with attention to detail awaits at 12 Illoura Place.
Set on 873m2 of land with nearly 280m2 of living, this impeccably designed home has clean modern lines and a luxurious interior with great natural light.
There is an oversize triple garage with much storage, a grand entry hallway, 4 bedrooms with robes and a study/5th bedroom, spacious main and ensuite bathrooms, powder room, large living area with polished concrete floor, beautiful kitchen with large walk-in pantry, tall raked ceilings, large windows and a second living area that also integrates outward to the garden and large in-ground pool.
A large covered alfresco area adjoins the pool and gardens, ready for a private, relaxed outdoor lifestyle.The home has solar boosted hot water, back to grid solar and solar heated pool.
Enjoy quality surrounds with nearby bush-lands, sporting facilities, schools and shops all nearby.

Description:
A Great Location and Affordable

Description:
The Choice Is Yours !!
Such a rare opportunity to purchase this B/V home set on 2735 sq.m allotment. Zoned residential with two street access, ideal for subdivision (STCA). The spacious home offers 3 bedrooms (all with BIR'S).Main with ensuite plus a private courtyard. Family bathroom and ensuite both require renovation. Huge lounge with timber cathedral ceilings and cosy solid fuel heater. Original country style kitchen with plenty of space for meals area. 2nd toilet off laundry.
Ducted evaporative cooling. Central atrium which could quite easily be converted to a 4th bedroom/study if required. Double carport with roller door, undercover outdoor entertaining, shed (no power or concrete), beautiful lily pond with a bridge. Good fencing. Close to Huntly shops, school and much more. Perfect for a tradie looking for a project or for somebody looking for lots of space.
Insights: 696 Midland Highway, Huntly VIC 3551 was last sold in 2002 and 24 other 3 bedroom house in Huntly have recently been sold.
